intro: Ficinia pallens, commonly known as the pale ficinia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araceae, which includes many aquatic and semi-aquatic plants. The plant features heart-shaped leaves that are typically pale green with a waxy surface. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are often surrounded by a modified leaf called a spathe. Ficinia pallens is often found in wetlands and marshy areas, where it plays a role in maintaining aquatic ecosystems.
